post.text: If Republicans actually wanted to protect women's health, they'd support Planned Parenthoodâ€”not attack it.

comment.author: Taryn
comment.text: I deduce that by their religious background/conviction or partisan reasoning they'd not normally support abortion, but they'd of course not want their wives and one of their female family members conceive a baby from unwanted pregnancy, so the only difference i, i mean we could discern is partisan difference in their view on PP, whether or what stake they prioritize over women's right to ab. I don't believe PP willfully disregard the value of every human lives.

replies.author: Taryn
replies.text: I mean we're talking about miscarriage or what is their role making more contraceptives available for them, or properly educating teen pregnancy, and there're exceptions of course like not having an intercourse in one's sound mind, or coerced, or outright rapist incidences, still we value both sides of spectrum, but the final decision can be left up to the woman, for we believe both human right for choice along with respect for human lives simultaneously,, in fact i think the determination warrants case by case inspection by multi parties, their families counselors, and medical expertise (given certain health out come from it), the fact is the media sensationalized how babies are treated in PP, and that may be far from the reality.
